issue.title: React-Calendar gulp build --ship Fails
issue.body:
## Category

- [X] Question
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Enhancement

## Authors
João Mendes

## Expected or Desired Behavior
**Sample: \samples\react-calendar**
Sample should perform the gulp build --ship without error

Standard gulp build is successful and running the Webpart in a O365 Dev Clients works. But attempting to package the Webpart fails due to this error.
Node Version: 10.19.0

## Observed Behavior
Currently is reporting the following error:
**src/webparts/calendar/components/Calendar.module.scss
 4:1  ×  Unexpected unknown pseudo-class selector ":export"   selector-pseudo-class-no-unknown
 5:3  ×  Expected "themeDark" to be "themedark"               property-case
 5:3  ×  Unexpected unknown property "themeDark"              property-no-unknown**
...
**The build failed because a task wrote output to stderr.
Exiting with exit code: 1**


## Steps to Reproduce
 - `npm install`
  - `gulp build`
  - `gulp bundle --ship`

## Submission Guidelines


Thanks for your contribution! Sharing is caring.

issue.title: Wordpress with Sharepoint
issue.body:
Dear Team,
I need your help to know how to display a new on landing page in sharepoint from website created in wordpress. We have news which is in a website(wordpress), I need that to be displayed in Sharepoint page.,
How can this be achived.

issue.title: Scripteditor.tsx (not working correctly)
issue.body:
Category

- [x] Question
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Enhancement

I added the Screenshots of my Problem down below. In the Scriptseditor.tsx there seem to be 2 missing attributes for the super class constructor and I don't know why and the second error is with the onChanged there seems to be no connection to IntrinsicAttributes? I actually would like to understand how this code works, cause I am very much learning it.

![Screenshot (16)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60918994/74232693-9d55ba00-4cc9-11ea-94de-437b53746f3e.png)
![Screenshot (17)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60918994/74232699-9f1f7d80-4cc9-11ea-9ace-aaa9b3cccf2a.png)

issue.title: React script editor
issue.body:
@wobba hi,
I cannot add the script editor package to appcatalo in sharepoint online modern page. I am getting below error.
There were errors when validating the App manifest.: Xml Validation Exception: 'The 'Name' attribute is invalid - The value 'Modern Script Editor web part by @mikaelsvenson' is invalid according to its datatype 'http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharepoint/2012/app/manifest:NameDefinition' - The Pattern constraint failed.' on line '1', position '110'.

Please help me to resolve this issue. Also it would be really grateful if you can provide steps to solve this.

rename.from: IceCreamShop: React / Jest example: which is a good di strategy in this example?
rename.to: IceCreamShop: React / Jest: which kind of di strategy would you suggest in this example?

issue.title: IceCreamShop: React / Jest: which kind of di strategy would you suggest in this example?
issue.body:
## Category

- [x] Question
- [ ] Bug
- [] Enhancement

## Authors
@VelinGeorgiev 
@VesaJuvonen 

Hi,

I have a question concerning dependency injection. I have a project setup with architecture similar to the IceCreamShop Samples. The Provider-Interfaces are being passed through the properties to the react component.

This works like a charm. From the outside I can provide specific implementations or within a test I can provide mocks.

However. When working with nested components this architecture ends up in bubbling the interfaces / dependencies from one property to the next property until it gets consumed by a nested child component.

Question: How would you implement a dependency injection in your example?

I have read many articles about react and di, but somehow I do not feel satisfied with all of them.
Using the reacts context as a place for sharing interface implementations feels wrong to me.
Higher Object Components are more suitable for compositing controls and I do not see a good strategy for resolving dependencies here.

The more I read, the more I am tempting to use third party modules like inversify.

What would you suggest?

I believe that in your example the most straight forward way would be having a possiblity to say:

export class IceCreamShop....


Constructor( // auto inject IIceCreamProvider here )...

Thanks for your opinion.

Regards

rename.to: IceCreamShop: React / Jest example: which is a good di strategy in this example?

issue.title: React twitter
issue.body:
|        Q        |                    A                    |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------- |
| Bug fix?        | no                               |
| New feature?    | no                               |
| New sample?     | yes                               |
| Related issues? | no |

## What's in this Pull Request?

Sample web part to display Twitter timeline.

This sample illustrates how to use [react-twitter-embed](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-twitter-embed) module to display Twitter timeline of specific profile, likes, list, collection or url.
It also uses [PnP React Controls](https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-fx-controls-react) and [PnP Property Controls](https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-fx-property-controls) for rich web part and property pane components.

The sample is related to the discussion in [PnP React Controls repo](https://github.com/SharePoint/sp-dev-fx-controls-react/issues/461)
